2019-11-03T21:03:47Z: If you're coming in late and missed how Lewis Hamilton clinched his sixth title, and how Valtteri Bottas beat him to victory, here's the race report. We'll see you in two weeks' time for the Brazilian Grand Prix.Lewis Hamilton seals sixth F1 title but Bottas denies him US GP winLewis Hamilton clinched his sixth Formula 1 title despite being passed for victory late on by Valtteri Bottas in the United States Grand Prix
2019-11-03T20:51:52Z: And it's doughnuts - or, in North America, donuts - for Hamilton.
2019-11-03T20:49:22Z: Out of the points: 11 Perez; 12 Raikkonen; 13 Stroll; 14 Giovinazzi; 15 Grosjean; 16 Gasly (not running); 17 Russell; 18 Magnussen (not running)
2019-11-03T20:48:46Z: Result: 1 Bottas; 2 Hamilton; 3 Verstappen; 4 Leclerc; 5 Albon; 6 Ricciardo; 7 Norris; 8 Sainz; 9 Hulkenberg; 10 Kvyat
2019-11-03T20:48:15Z: Verstappen finishes 0.854s behind Hamilton in third place.
2019-11-03T20:48:05Z: Bottas crosses the line to win the US GP, but second place means Hamilton is a six-time world champion!
2019-11-03T20:46:58Z: Bottas is cruising to this race win now, with Hamilton hanging on to second by 0.6s at the moment.
2019-11-03T20:46:19Z: Verstappen is close behind Hamilton as they begin the last lap but it doesn't look like he'll be quite close enough.
2019-11-03T20:46:09Z: That's Magnussen in the gravel! Day over for the Dane, it looks like his brakes had just gone into turn 12.
2019-11-03T20:45:24Z: Gasly has had to stop to make it to the end, his tyres were that far gone.
2019-11-03T20:44:34Z: Verstappen is now poised to get DRS from Hamilton with two laps to go.
2019-11-03T20:43:49Z: Gasly has, indeed, run out of tyres - he was 5s slower than Hulkenberg and Kvyat, and falls behind the pair.
2019-11-03T20:43:02Z: Perez, meanwhile, relegates Gasly to 10th with a nice move at Turn 14 - and Hulkenberg might have the final say on points here too.
2019-11-03T20:42:19Z: Verstappen is now within 2.5s of Hamilton for second place.
2019-11-03T20:42:01Z: Hamilton is already 1.7s behind Bottas. He's still emphatically on course to become world champion today, but his driving has shown he'd have loved to have done it with a race win.
2019-11-03T20:41:47Z: Norris has managed to wind Sainz in very quickly, and makes a move on his team-mate to grab seventh place.
2019-11-03T20:40:43Z: Bottas immediately sprints away from Hamilton, who now has Verstappen 3s behind him and closing fast.
2019-11-03T20:40:15Z: Bottas is right up behind Hamilton onto the back straight, hits the DRS, takes to the inside and snatches the race lead!
2019-11-03T20:39:23Z: Hamilton gets held up by Gasly into the final corner, Bottas is 0.4s behind him as the cross the line with four laps left.
2019-11-03T20:38:57Z: A lock-up from Bottas now as he swarms all over the back of Hamilton.
2019-11-03T20:38:44Z: Bottas goes to the outside of Hamilton at the end of the back straight but the leader keeps him out wide.
2019-11-03T20:38:25Z: Hamilton runs slightly wide at the Turn 12 hairpin, giving Bottas a good run...
2019-11-03T20:38:11Z: Hamilton pulls a tiny bit more breathing space over Bottas through the first sector.
2019-11-03T20:38:07Z: Norris streaks clear of Gasly now, making his way up to eighth place.
2019-11-03T20:37:53Z: Verstappen was a second quicker than both Mercedes on that lap and is 5.6s off the lead with five laps to go.
2019-11-03T20:37:21Z: The two Mercedes are fractionally under one second apart as they approach a massive gaggle of traffic.
2019-11-03T20:36:05Z: Bottas was only two tenths quicker than Hamilton on that last lap, but he's about to edge into DRS range.
2019-11-03T20:35:53Z: Norris dispatches Perez, and Gasly's in touching distance too. Norris was 2s quicker than Gasly last time round.
2019-11-03T20:34:58Z: Hamilton does his fastest first sector of the day so far, he's not giving up on winning this race even though he only needs eighth to be champion.
2019-11-03T20:34:10Z: Albon passes Ricciardo and claims fifth place.
2019-11-03T20:33:17Z: Verstappen is currently the fastest of the three leaders...
2019-11-03T20:31:57Z: Just 2.007s between leader Hamilton and Bottas now with nine laps left after this one.
2019-11-03T20:31:09Z: Albon has swiftly recovered ground after moving to soft tyres and is past Sainz for sixth. Next target Ricciardo is 3.6s ahead and the Red Bull is 2s per lap quicker than the Renault right now.
2019-11-03T20:31:00Z: Hulkenberg is asked to let Raikkonen past, which he sounds very displeased by.
2019-11-03T20:29:44Z: Bottas is only taking a few tenths per lap off Hamilton at the moment. The gap is down to 3s but that storming closing speed is gone.
2019-11-03T20:28:47Z: Hulkenberg forces his way past Raikkonen at turn 12 to move up to 11th. But he's 11s down on 10th-placed Norris.
2019-11-03T20:28:42Z: Leclerc achieves his fastest lap mission - a 1m36.169s.
2019-11-03T20:27:59Z: Albon dispatches Gasly, and now Sainz is just up the road.
2019-11-03T20:27:09Z: Bottas is now within 3.6s of Hamilton with 12 laps left, with Verstappen a further 5.8s behind.
2019-11-03T20:26:49Z: Norris pits from sixth, and rejoins in P10 on a set of mediums. There's a bit of a sticky wheelnut, but luckily a repeat of Mexico is avoided.
2019-11-03T20:26:30Z: So Ricciardo is now back up to fifth. He ran long in his first stint so might he try to make his current hards last to the end?
2019-11-03T20:26:03Z: Norris makes another pitstop from sixth too. He's gone to mediums and rejoins 10th.
2019-11-03T20:25:20Z: Leclerc makes a second pitstop from fourth place. He has enough of a gap back to Ricciardo to hold his place. The Ferrari goes for softs, which might give it a shot at fastest lap at least.
2019-11-03T20:24:39Z: With those softs, Albon makes light work of Perez and will now have to pass Gasly for the 900th time this weekend.
2019-11-03T20:24:03Z: Traffic is helping Hamilton's cause still, though, he's getting through the backmarkers better and has steadied his lead at 4.4s over Bottas and 10.4s over Verstappen.
2019-11-03T20:22:36Z: Albon makes a third pitstop, having just made it up to fifth. With the upper midfield still tight, he falls back to 10th place but he now has some softs to play with for the remaining laps.
2019-11-03T20:21:39Z: Verstappen is now in the traffic and he only got a single tenth off Hamilton on the last lap.
2019-11-03T20:21:36Z: Kvyat locks up heavily to let Hulkenberg into P12, but the two now come in to pit having found a free space ahead of Magnussen to rejoin into.
2019-11-03T20:21:25Z: The charge is back under way for Bottas, he takes another second off Hamilton and is now 4.5s behind.
2019-11-03T20:19:42Z: Bottas is dealing with a bit of traffic and it's cost him more than it cost Hamilton, the gap going back up a couple of tenths.
2019-11-03T20:18:05Z: Bottas's pace faded on that last lap - he only took 0.6s off Hamilton. The gap is now 5.3s with 18 laps left.
2019-11-03T20:17:24Z: In the midfield, Perez is hunting Raikkonen down at a pretty vast rate of knots. He's taking healthy chunks out of the Finn at each sector, with a tantalising 10th on offer.
2019-11-03T20:16:36Z: Albon dives past Ricciardo to take fifth, which will probably be the limit of his recovery charge as Leclerc is 26.7s ahead.
2019-11-03T20:16:18Z: A new fastest lap from Bottas - a 1m36.957s - 1.7s than Verstappen just managed on the same strategy!
2019-11-03T20:16:02Z: Bottas is massively faster than Hamilton on these new tyres - taking 1.2s out of the leader in the middle sector of the lap alone. He's already got his team-mate's lead down to under 6s.
2019-11-03T20:13:55Z: The recovering Albon is now right on Ricciardo's tail for fifth.
2019-11-03T20:13:14Z: So Hamilton is back into the lead, but is on old-ish hard tyres. Bottas and Verstappen will be hunting him down on new mediums over the remaining 20 laps.
2019-11-03T20:12:40Z: Like Verstappen, Bottas goes back onto medium tyres.
2019-11-03T20:12:31Z: Mercedes tells Bottas to pit, and he does so.
2019-11-03T20:12:02Z: Meanwhile Hamilton is within 11s of leader Bottas with 21 laps to go and Bottas due to surely pit soon.
2019-11-03T20:11:44Z: Bottas had enough of a lead over Verstappen not to be worried about immediately being jumped by the Red Bull on new tyres, but he now can't afford to stay out too long.
2019-11-03T20:11:19Z: Verstappen goes for it and makes his second pitstop from second place. He swaps from hards to medium tyres and rejoins third.
2019-11-03T20:10:21Z: Kubica retires from P19, presumably with mechanical issues.
2019-11-03T20:09:57Z: Hamilton is now within 12.3s of Bottas, so at this rate his lead when Bottas pits will be quite healthy.
2019-11-03T20:08:55Z: Ricciardo has managed to quell the threat from Norris for his fifth place - they're now 2.2s apart having been much closer.
2019-11-03T20:08:15Z: Verstappen has fallen 7.6s away from leader Bottas and is 7.4s ahead of the closing Hamilton.
2019-11-03T20:07:55Z: Albon eases past Sainz now, and continues his progress up the field. Norris is about 4s ahead, with Ricciardo also within striking distance.
2019-11-03T20:07:50Z: Hamilton is still a steady second per lap quicker than leader Bottas, with that gap down to 15.1s now.
2019-11-03T20:04:57Z: We missed Albon getting clear of Gasly, and Kvyat has also been passed by Perez - not a good couple of laps for the Toro Rosso boys.
2019-11-03T20:04:28Z: Lead gaps on lap 31: 1 Bottas; 2 Verstappen +6.8s; 3 Hamilton +17.4s; 4 Leclerc +43.8s; 5 Ricciardo +59.8s; 6 Norris +1m01.5s
2019-11-03T20:02:46Z: Given Hulkenberg's hard-compounds were gone at half-distance, eking out the mediums for the rest is a like asking for a giraffe for Christmas - a tall order.
2019-11-03T20:01:14Z: Hulkenberg's tyres are toast, and has so little grip his wiggle lets Albon past. He now pits for fresh mediums.
2019-11-03T20:00:00Z: Leclerc's now doing his best laps of the race - faster than everyone except Hamilton, and he's stormed away from the brief threat of Ricciardo's Renault. The fourth-to-fifth gap is now 13.4s and Ricciardo is under big pressure from Norris.
2019-11-03T19:59:42Z: Sainz dives down the inside of Hulkenberg for seventh, who still hasn't stopped yet.
2019-11-03T19:58:37Z: At this rate, Hamilton will easily end up ahead of Bottas and Verstappen when they make their second pitstops, but he'll have a hard job holding them back off.
2019-11-03T19:58:17Z: As expected, Hamilton is making the most his fresh tyres for a bit of a sprint - he sets a new fastest lap of 1m38.446s and is back within 19.5s of leader Bottas and 13.7s of second-placed Verstappen already.
2019-11-03T19:57:29Z: Albon returns to the top 10, passing Raikkonen into turn 12. Gasly is the next box to tick.
2019-11-03T19:56:16Z: Lead gaps on lap 25: 1 Bottas; 2 Verstappen +5.7s; 3 Hamilton +21.7s; 4 Leclerc +45.4s; 5 Ricciardo +54.7s; 6 Norris +56.2s
2019-11-03T19:56:12Z: Perez does indeed now pit, rejoining in P14 behind Kvyat.
2019-11-03T19:55:29Z: Norris passes Hulkenberg too to move back into sixth place.
2019-11-03T19:55:16Z: Hamilton has no trouble rejoining third on his new hard tyres, but he's 23.1s off the lead now. Bottas probably has to pit again but right now he has enough margin to - though you'd expect some strong new-tyre pace from Hamilton now.
2019-11-03T19:54:36Z: Ricciardo passes yet-to-pit team-mate Hulkenberg for fifth.
2019-11-03T19:54:11Z: Hamilton now does pit, with Bottas already storming away in the lead.
2019-11-03T19:54:06Z: Perez falls victim to Norris, and the yet-to-stop Racing Point driver will have Sainz for company shortly.
2019-11-03T19:53:39Z: Bottas breezes past Hamilton on the back straight and retakes the race lead. So what next for Mercedes' strategy?
2019-11-03T19:52:58Z: Norris passes Perez too so is up to seventh, 1.5s behind his early-race sparring partner Ricciardo.
2019-11-03T19:52:06Z: Ricciardo grabs sixth from Perez, who has risen up the order from his pitlane start by not pitting yet.
2019-11-03T19:51:24Z: Bottas is now within 1.4s of leader Hamilton and it looks like Mercedes is about to pit the race leader.
2019-11-03T19:51:06Z: Leclerc passes the yet to stop Hulkenberg for fourth place with ease.
2019-11-03T19:50:48Z: Ricciardo makes his pitstop, going to hards, and rejoins seventh behind the yet-to-stop Perez. That puts Ricciardo 5s behind Leclerc in fifth.
2019-11-03T19:49:11Z: It looks like Ferrari was simply struggling to get the left rear tyre onto Leclerc's car there.
2019-11-03T19:48:45Z: Albon stops again, setting his progress into the top 10 back a bit. It's another set of mediums for the Thai driver.
2019-11-03T19:48:31Z: Leclerc goes onto hard tyres and comes out sixth behind Hulkenberg, just ahead of Kvyat.
2019-11-03T19:48:18Z: Leclerc comes into the pits from fourth place, and it's a very poor stop - he's there for 7.7s. That could actually bring Ricciardo a lot closer to him.
2019-11-03T19:47:50Z: Lap 20 lead gaps: 1 Hamilton (yet to stop); 2 Bottas +5.1s; 3 Verstappen +10.8s
2019-11-03T19:47:36Z: And that aforementioned undercut worked for Sainz, who rejoins ahead of Gasly. McLaren played that rather nicely.
2019-11-03T19:47:11Z: Fifth-placed Ricciardo is actually keeping pace with fourth-placed Leclerc at the moment. They're 8.6s apart but the Renault is doing the same times as the Ferrari.
2019-11-03T19:46:43Z: Norris goes to hard tyres and rejoins in 10th.
2019-11-03T19:46:07Z: Bottas notches up another fastest lap - a 1m38.916s. It's now 6.6s between the two Mercedes.
2019-11-03T19:46:04Z: Sainz is presumably having a go at undercutting Gasly, pitting for hard tyres. Raikkonen and Magnussen also pit.
2019-11-03T19:45:17Z: Another lap 2s quicker than Hamilton means Bottas is now within 7.6s of the race lead on lap 19.
2019-11-03T19:45:01Z: Bottas's pace is much better than Verstappen's in this phase - he went a second quicker than the Red Bull behind on that lap and is now 4.8s clear of it after they were briefly nose to tail following the pitstops. Does that mean Bottas is now pushing to make a two-stop work and Verstappen is nursing his rubber for a one-stop? Or is the Mercedes simply that much happier on the hard tyre?
2019-11-03T19:44:34Z: Giovinazzi pits from P16, takes some fresh hard tyres and returns on track in 18th.
2019-11-03T19:43:43Z: This is starting to look like a repeat of the Japanese GP in terms of Bottas pitting earlier then hunting down Hamilton with huge pace and Mercedes having some quandaries.
2019-11-03T19:43:16Z: Hamilton's engineer intimates that other drivers - and he surely means Bottas and Verstappen - are on two-stop strategies but suggests the points leader sticks to his current plan.
2019-11-03T19:42:47Z: Another new fastest lap from Bottas, a 1m38.943s, which brings him to within 10.6s of the lead.
2019-11-03T19:42:04Z: Here's a look at Vettel's awkward exit from the race
2019-11-03T19:41:50Z: Bottas puts in a new fastest lap of 1m39.201s, which was 2s faster than leader Hamilton. The gap is down to 11.8s.
2019-11-03T19:40:29Z: Verstappen set the fastest race lap so far - a 1m39.604s - on his first full flying lap after his stop, and he now blasts past Leclerc too.
2019-11-03T19:40:07Z: Bottas has a lot more pace on fresh hard tyres than leader Hamilton does on used mediums now and already has the gap down to 14.1s. Will Hamilton try running long and fighting back later, or will he rapidly pit?
2019-11-03T19:39:48Z: Magnussen was easy pickings for Perez and Albon, who are the midfield's movers and shakers. Kvyat is next up, just over four seconds ahead.
2019-11-03T19:39:31Z: Leclerc tries to defend the inside lead but Bottas easily goes around the outside of him into the first corner.
2019-11-03T19:39:09Z: Bottas has already caught the yet-to-pit Leclerc for second place.
2019-11-03T19:38:07Z: So Hamilton has inherited the lead of the race by 13.5s over Leclerc and 16.8s over first-of-the-pitters Bottas and Verstappen.
2019-11-03T19:37:49Z: It turns out Perez wasn't next for Albon, as the flagging Grosjean falls prey to both drivers. Magnussen's next up.
2019-11-03T19:37:43Z: Bottas comes out still 1.9s ahead of Verstappen - can the Red Bull attack on warm tyres?
2019-11-03T19:37:25Z: Bottas switches to hard tyres too, will he rejoin still ahead of Verstappen...?
2019-11-03T19:37:12Z: Bottas comes in from the race lead...
2019-11-03T19:37:02Z: Verstappen now uses his fresh tyres to do the fastest middle sector of the race so far.
2019-11-03T19:36:48Z: Mercedes looks like it's responding with an instant pitstop - will it be Bottas or Hamilton?
2019-11-03T19:36:16Z: With Verstappen out of the way, Hamilton immediately does the fastest first sector of anyone so far.
2019-11-03T19:36:00Z: Verstappen pits from second place on lap 13, meaning we now have a Mercedes 1-2. Onto hard tyres for the Red Bull, which rejoins ahead of fifth-placed Ricciardo.
2019-11-03T19:35:08Z: Albon breezes past Giovinazzi to snatch 15th, and Perez will be the next target for the Red Bull driver.
2019-11-03T19:34:25Z: Verstappen had asked Red Bull to let him know if Hamilton was in his DRS range - and hopefully it's now doing so as the Mercedes is right on his tail.
2019-11-03T19:33:37Z: Perez was released by Stroll pitting for hards, and Albon's now looking to pass Giovinazzi in good time.
2019-11-03T19:33:02Z: Kvyat has now dispatched Magnussen for 11th, and down the road Perez and Giovinazzi are having a great battle over 14th - which Perez now takes.
2019-11-03T19:32:17Z: Having cleared Norris, Ricciardo is getting away from the McLaren in fifth place but isn't closing on Leclerc ahead.
2019-11-03T19:32:00Z: This is looking like a very lonely afternoon for Leclerc - he's now 13s off the lead, 9.6s behind Hamilton ahead and 7.4s clear of Ricciardo in fifth.
2019-11-03T19:31:28Z: Action from the first lap as the Ferraris lost ground
2019-11-03T19:29:39Z: Off-camera, Magnussen has fallen out of the points, losing places to P17-starting Raikkonen and Hulkenberg. Kvyat is six tenths behind.
2019-11-03T19:28:24Z: While we were watching Vettel's drama, Ricciardo made a move on Norris at the end of the back straight to take fifth place from the McLaren.
2019-11-03T19:27:59Z: Vettel seemed to be proceeding normally through the downhill Turn 9 when the right rear corner of his car suddenly dropped.
2019-11-03T19:27:02Z: Vettel brings his Ferrari to a halt in a runoff area. His race is over.
2019-11-03T19:26:32Z: Vettel has a problem at the rear of his car - possibly a suspension breakage!
2019-11-03T19:26:08Z: Pitlane starter Perez is stuck behind Stroll, and is barely lapping faster than Russell behind him. Racing Point isn't having a good race so far.
2019-11-03T19:25:23Z: Norris is still holding Ricciardo and Vettel at bay successfully for fifth, while falling away steadily from Leclerc ahead. Leclerc is regularly lapping about a second off the leaders' pace.
2019-11-03T19:24:42Z: Bottas has now got his lead over Verstappen up to two seconds for the first time.
2019-11-03T19:24:29Z: There's a queue forming behind Magnussen, who has just 0.6s in hand over Raikkonen, who has Hulkenberg and Kvyat slowly closing in, all lapping in the 1m43s.
2019-11-03T19:22:01Z: Albon, on those fresh mediums, is clocking fastest laps. He's on a 1m40.377s at the moment.
2019-11-03T19:21:56Z: Lead order on lap five: 1 Bottas; 2 Verstappen +1.8s; 3 Hamilton +3.6s; 4 Leclerc +8.1s; 5 Norris +12.2s; 6 Ricciardo +12.9s; 7 Vettel +14.0s
2019-11-03T19:20:50Z: And it's no further action for that investigation, that's a swift decision by the FIA.
2019-11-03T19:19:16Z: The Sainz-Albon skirmish is under investigation by the stewards.
2019-11-03T19:18:23Z: Norris continues to hold fifth, with Ricciardo and Vettel right behind him.
2019-11-03T19:18:05Z: Sainz had the opposite start to team-mate Norris, and has dropped into ninth behind Gasly. Magnussen completes the top 10 as it stands.
2019-11-03T19:17:30Z: Hamilton sets a fastest race lap of 1m41.043s as he closes in on Bottas and Verstappen ahead.
2019-11-03T19:17:10Z: Leclerc doesn't seem to have any speed either, he's already 5.7s off the lead in fourth place.
2019-11-03T19:16:49Z: Vettel's slide continues, he's now overtaken by Ricciardo's Renault and falls to seventh!
2019-11-03T19:16:35Z: Ricciardo steams past Vettel at turn 1, it's a tough opening lap for the Ferrari driver.
2019-11-03T19:16:25Z: Amid all that, Bottas has managed to quickly pull out a 1.3s lead over Verstappen, with Hamilton another 1.3s back in third.
2019-11-03T19:15:27Z: Norris manages to manages Vettel for fifth as the Ferraris attack each other!
2019-11-03T19:15:13Z: Albon bounced off Sainz as they went through the first corner and has dropped down the order after running wide and briefly getting slightly airborne.
2019-11-03T19:14:36Z: Leclerc attacks Vettel too and demotes the sister Ferrari to fifth, though he tries to retaliate straight away.
2019-11-03T19:14:15Z: Hamilton now attacks Vettel and takes third!
2019-11-03T19:13:58Z: Hamilton manages to get around Leclerc to take fourth place by the first corner.
2019-11-03T19:13:43Z: The lights go out... Verstappen draws alongside Vettel on the outside as Bottas stays ahead.
2019-11-03T19:13:25Z: In other tyre news, Raikkonen is the only driver outside of the top 10 on softs, while Kvyat and Hulkenberg are on hards.
2019-11-03T19:12:16Z: Bottas leads the frontrunners towards their grid slots.
2019-11-03T19:10:30Z: This has been painted in the event Hamilton wins the title today. No pressure, then.
2019-11-03T19:09:21Z: On the strategy front, it's probably that limbo between one-stop and two, which could potentially be interesting. The top five all have medium tyres, with Albon on softs as Red Bull split strategies.
2019-11-03T19:05:02Z: But the big story is the 2019 title, which Lewis Hamilton can wrap up if he scores just four points. It should be a formality, but as Murray Walker would opine, F1 is 'if' spelled backwards...
2019-11-03T19:03:50Z: Some news from the grid - Verstappen has a cracked endplate, which Red Bull have now fixed. Definitely not an ideal situation, moments before the race gets going...
2019-11-03T19:01:44Z: Hello everyone, and welcome to our Autosport Live coverage of the United States Grand Prix at Austin! Ten minutes to go until the race gets under way, so if you're making a cuppa you'd better be quick...
